rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

Did you know that your one-on-one time with your teen can help them at school? Today we will share some ideas on how to do this.

By spending time with them, you teach them important life skills that will help them at school and at home.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about helping your teen learn.

Did you know that your one-on-one time with your teen can help them at school? Today we will share some ideas on how to do this.

By spending time with them, you teach them important life skills that will help them at school and at home.

media_title.eng: How can I help my teen learn?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!

rows.media_title: How can I help my teen learn?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone!

Today's topic is helping your teen to learn.

There are different fun ways and activities that we can use as parents to help our teens learn. Some of those activities could be playing games together or doing house chores together. Remember, our teens learn better when they are having fun!

media_title.eng: Placeholder text - Anna - we need a media title similar to the intro (caregiver testimonial)

media_transcript.eng:
Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him.

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.

rows.media_title: Placeholder text - Anna - we need a media title similar to the intro (caregiver testimonial)
rows.media_transcript:
Since we started spending more one-on-one time together, we have a better bond, a better understanding between us. I feel better about how I am parenting. I am doing a better job as a parent, not just being a parent, but showing love and working with him.

I like that the app encourages you to work with your children, and not just you are the parent up there and they are down there as the children, but they are involved a lot in the decisions you make that impact on them.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Caregivers and teens who spend time together are more likely to have happy and healthy relationships. But spending time together is not always easy. Sometimes we can both get angry, get annoyed and argue or fight.

Let‚Äôs take a look at an example.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Caregivers and teens who spend time together are more likely to have happy and healthy relationships. But spending time together is not always easy. Sometimes we can both get angry, get annoyed and argue or fight.

Let‚Äôs take a look at an example.

text_2.eng: One afternoon, @data.characters.female_child_1.name is looking after her younger sibling @data.characters.female_child_2.name.

character_1_text.eng: (ü§î_thinking_) It has been such a hard day at school‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt wait for @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name to come home so I can tell her about it.

rows.text_2: One afternoon, @data.characters.female_child_1.name is looking after her younger sibling @data.characters.female_child_2.name.
rows.character_1_text: (ü§î_thinking_) It has been such a hard day at school‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt wait for @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name to come home so I can tell her about it.
@data.characters.female_child_1.name, why did you not cook dinner yet?! Why do I always have to do everything myself?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name, why did you not cook dinner yet?! Why do I always have to do everything myself?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let's think about what happened in this story.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let's think about what happened in this story.

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name was upset that her mother did not see how she helped at home

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.female_child_1.name reacted this way because her mother did not talk to her about her day, blamed her for not cooking yet and did not thank @data.characters.female_child_1.name for helping at home.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name was not able to talk to her mother about her hard day at school.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.female_child_1.name reacted this way because her mother did not talk to her about her day, blamed her for not cooking yet and did not thank @data.characters.female_child_1.name for helping at home.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name blamed @data.characters.female_child_1.name for not cooking dinner yet.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, all of these are true. @data.characters.female_child_1.name reacted this way because her mother did not talk to her about her day, blamed her for not cooking yet and did not thank @data.characters.female_child_1.name for helping at home.

quiz_2_question.eng: How will this affect the relationship between @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name and @data.characters.female_child_1.name?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name will not want to help with house chores, as her mother did not appreciate it.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: These are all true. @data.characters.female_child_1.name will not want to help around the house or speak to her mother about her problems because her mother does not thank her or listen to her. @data.characters.female_child_1.name will also treat her siblings the same way because that is what she has learnt from her mother.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: @data.characters.female_child_1.name will not want to speak to her mother about her problems because she was not given a chance to talk about it.

Hi everyone, I am so glad to see you! @data.characters.female_child_1.name, thank you for looking after your sister and washing the school clothes. I am going to wash my hands, and then we can cook together and you can tell me about your day.

character_1_text.eng: Hi everyone, I am so glad to see you! @data.characters.female_child_1.name, thank you for looking after your sister and washing the school clothes. I am going to wash my hands, and then we can cook together and you can tell me about your day.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you, @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name, you can call me when you are ready.

rows.character_2_text: Thank you, @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name, you can call me when you are ready.

character_1_text.eng: I am glad we have this time together. I actually wanted to tell you about a problem I had at school today.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you for telling me. I am sure we can come up with a solution together.

quiz_1_question.eng: How did @data.characters.female_child_1.name and @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name feel before they got to speak to each other?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, both of them had long, hard days.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, both of them had long, hard days.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, both of them had long, hard days.

quiz_2_question.eng: What did @data.characters.female_caregiver_1.name do differently this time?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: She took a few minutes for herself to relax and get settled at home before talking with @data.characters.female_child_1.name.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: She asked @data.characters.female_child_1.name to help with cooking, so she could get dinner done AND have time to talk.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: She praised @data.characters.female_child_1.name for doing specific household chores.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: She showed @data.characters.female_child_1.name that she is available to talk and listen.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Yes, all of these are true.

quiz_3_question.eng: How did @data.characters.female_child_1.name and her mother feel afterwards?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, taking a moment to talk while doing house chores helped them both!

By taking time for yourself, asking your teen to do a house chore or activity with you, and giving them space to talk to you, you are creating a safe space for them to learn with you.

This is an easy way to build a healthy relationship with your teen. This will help them learn important things they do not learn at school.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Let‚Äôs think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let‚Äôs think of activities you can do with your teen to help them learn.

Remember, teens are better at remembering what they learnt when it is fun.

text_2.eng: Here are some ideas you could try today:

section_1_text.eng: Share a story from your childhood or culture with your teen. Or let them share a story with you. This is a great way to learn while building a healthy relationship.

section_2_text.eng: Ask your teen if they would like to walk outside with you. This is good exercise and is a good time for you and your teen to talk about what is on your mind and how you both are feeling.

section_3_text.eng: There are always things that need to be done at home. This is a great way to spend time together. Ask your teen to help you with the cooking or cleaning. You can talk to each other and teach them why doing these things is important.

rows.text_2: Here are some ideas you could try today:
rows.section_1_text: Share a story from your childhood or culture with your teen. Or let them share a story with you. This is a great way to learn while building a healthy relationship.
rows.section_2_text: Ask your teen if they would like to walk outside with you. This is good exercise and is a good time for you and your teen to talk about what is on your mind and how you both are feeling.
rows.section_3_text: There are always things that need to be done at home. This is a great way to spend time together. Ask your teen to help you with the cooking or cleaning. You can talk to each other and teach them why doing these things is important.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills you can use to help your teen learn!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are this week‚Äôs takeaway skills you can use to help your teen learn!

section_1_text.eng: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.

section_2_text.eng: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them ‚Äúlearn how to learn‚Äù, because they feel safe with you.

section_3_text.eng: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.

rows.section_1_text: People learn better when they learn with others. Spend time with your teen and let them learn with you. When you do activities together, you give them space to learn, to make mistakes and to ask you questions.
rows.section_2_text: Your teen will learn from you if they know you support them. Let them try things and be patient with them. This helps them ‚Äúlearn how to learn‚Äù, because they feel safe with you.
rows.section_3_text: Praising your teen is a powerful way to help them try again. Teens do not get things right the first time and should learn how to try again. Praise them for trying to do things, so they can learn from their mistakes.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Small actions make a big difference. Helping your teen learn can be stressful. But making your daily activities fun and doing them together is a great way to help your teen‚Äôs development and education.

This week's home practice is to try some activities with your teen!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Small actions make a big difference. Helping your teen learn can be stressful. But making your daily activities fun and doing them together is a great way to help your teen‚Äôs development and education.

This week's home practice is to try some activities with your teen!

text_2.eng:
It‚Äôs not always easy to think of things to do with your teen. Here are some fun activity ideas from other parents:

**Music and dance:**
- Dancing is a fun way to get exercise, and a great way to learn about your teen‚Äôs interests.
- Tip: Let your teen show you music and dance moves. And don't take it too seriously, be silly and have fun together.
**Check-in chat:**
- Ask each other, ‚ÄúWhat made you happy today?‚Äù
- Ask each other, ‚ÄúWhat difficulty did you face today?‚Äù
- Ask each other, ‚ÄúHow can I help you?‚Äù
- Try to do this together every day; it could be when you are eating dinner together or before you go to bed.

quiz_1_question.eng:
Can you do it?

**Music and dance:**

- Tip: Let your teen show you music and dance moves. And don't take it too seriously, be silly and have fun together.
**Check-in chat:**
- Ask each other, ‚ÄúWhat made you happy today?‚Äù
- Ask each other, ‚ÄúWhat difficulty did you face today?‚Äù
- Ask each other, ‚ÄúHow can I help you?‚Äù
- Try to do this together every day; it could be when you are eating dinner together or before you go to bed.

media_transcript.eng:
In the past there were times my mom got angry and she would shout at me before beating me. But since my mom started using ParentApp, she tries to create time for us to interact and for us to have fun discussions.

We play games, we sing together and other stuff‚Ä¶ She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like ‚Äúwhat you did is not good‚Äù and such.

rows.media_title: Placeholder - context needed here Anna (this is a media title of teen testimonial)
rows.media_transcript:
In the past there were times my mom got angry and she would shout at me before beating me. But since my mom started using ParentApp, she tries to create time for us to interact and for us to have fun discussions.

We play games, we sing together and other stuff‚Ä¶ She takes time to listen before jumping to conclusions, like she listens and then she calms down and takes her time to explain, and then be like ‚Äúwhat you did is not good‚Äù and such.
